data.title: Radar Jammer doesn't deflect V8 missiles
data.body: It seems the radar jammer doesn't work for any kind of missile, i noticed for example the ones launched from the V8 trucks aren't deflected. Is this by design?

data.title: Fix soviet units not stopping to hunt after being captured in Exodus

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
and makes hijackers unbuildable in Evacuation. I made them unbuildable there because we don't allow building mechanics (which are somewhat the counter parts to hijackers) in this mission as well.
Fixes #12183.

This PR also fixes soviet units not attack moving to their rally point in Exodus, and also removes some code duplication (we don't need to check for idling units inside the Tick function if we can just assign them a hunt trigger directly after they're created).

data.title: Change the name of a couple of units.
data.body:
(RA) Transport Helicopter -> Chinook **MERGED**

Everyone calls it a Chinook. Noone calls it a Transport Helicopter. The SHP icon says 'Chinook'.
Apparently the real Chinook came into service for the US Army 1962. C&C RA supposedly happened in the 50's (http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Red_Alert_universe_timeline) but whatever - it's an alternate timeline switching around a lot of stuff.
http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Chinook_(Red_Alert)

(TD) Rocket Launcer -> MLRS (disputed)

This was actually changed in favour of the Rocket Launcher sometime in 2014. The SHP file for the unit says Rocket Launcher so I guess thats more consistent... but the name MLRS is better. New SHP file would be needed.
http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Multiple_Launch_Rocket_System_(Tiberian_Dawn)

(TD) Mobile S.A.M. -> Mobile SAM

Looks better imo and consistent with other units with abbreviations. New SHP file would be needed.

**EDIT**:

Some honorable mentions:

(RA) Shipyard -> Naval Yard #5992 **MERGED**

(RA) M.A.D. Tank -> MAD Tank (SHP icon)

(RA) Medics -> Field Medics

(RA) HIND -> Cobra

data.title: Video after the briefing
data.body:
The video that starts once you start a mission plays over the music on the main menu for both CnC TD and RA, worse still on the RA one the menu 'battle scene' carries on making noise so it's very hard to watch the video especially on that one.  I'm sure it's already been reported but I can't actually seem to find a report of this.  This is as of the most up to date play test. 

Just tested this again, seems to happen when you watch a brief but don't let it finish and press play.  It's not a huge bug but it's there.

Additionally after some more testing seems like the there is no video before GDI level 2 starts.  Though it does have one for when you complete the level.

data.title: Cloak effects lacks visual transition
data.body:
In the original games,
- [ ] not just the owner and allies, but also enemies would see the stealth effect for a little before the actor became invisible, and after it became visible.
- [ ] The distortion effect in TD would even fade in and out smoothly during the transition.
- [ ] The transparency effect in TS faded in and out smoothly during the transition, too.

data.title: Uncloak on damage by default
data.body:
Not doing so is a regression compared to pre-20160508 releases and probably unexpected behaviour for the majority of modders.

All actors in the shipping mods which are _not_ supposed to uncloak on damage are already overriding the default at yaml level, so there aren't any regressions to expect on that end.

Fixes #12192.

data.title: Allow VS2015 to format solution file.
data.body:
See #11753.

This also removes a duplicate entry for `evacuation.lua`.

data.title: RA Phase Transport, TD Stealth tank & D2k Stealth Raider don't uncloak on damage
data.body:
Aside from `Move`, which is obviously intentional, `Damage` is the only trigger not listed in the internal default of `Cloak.UncloakOn`.

`UncloakType.Damage` was most likely ommitted by accident in
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/f46185b85f458f44f32787f481983d91575d6808
because unlike the other 5 possible triggers, damage was previously hardcoded to trigger an uncloak and did not have a boolean field.

This also means this is a regression and should probably go into stable, as it affects at least 1 unit in each shipping mod + actors collecting stealth crates in TD.

data.title: Navy AI in RA using aircraft that can't attack air to try to attack air
data.body: It seems like in Skirmish mission the Navy AI at least tries to use migs to attack my helicopters which they can't succeeded in doing as they don't have anti-air weapons.  They end up just circling around them and following them, making them very easy to kill.

data.title: Tweak SubMissileAA towards more traditional AA.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
The AA that came with #12106 intended for it to perform as, and recreate, the AA Projectile:Bullet behaviour as proposed originally. I believe now this was a mistake. Regardless of intent, players will likely look upon its vs moving targets to be faulty rather than a feature. Community feedback:
https://www.reddit.com/r/openra/comments/55gx81/ballistic_submarines_aa_useless/
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=298167#298167
Range was lowered to simulate the Projectile:Bullet's effective hits vs close targets and Turn Rate was lowered to deal with visual targeting issues vs moving targets. All in all these compromises should probably be scrapped for the AA MissileSub's first release cycle.

The PR's changes are for the most part modelled after Frame Limiter's SubMissileAA which features a more familiar approach. http://resource.openra.net/maps/16243/ This will make the AA perform better vs YAKs/MiGs and overall more efficient with increased range + speed with a slightly lowered damage output. 

Also, I raised the SubMissile (vs ground) angle just a tiny bit (120, up from 105) for visual sake (originally 165).

Another issue not brought up previously is wether the MissileSub should be able to use its AA and AG at the same time. Currently there's a  seperate reload time for both weapons. **Edit**: Apparently this is the case for all units in ORA. I hadn't noticed.

data.title: Add an "unstable" parameter to the [Desc] attribute.
data.body:
Our expectation for features to be complete and stable before merging them upstream makes life difficult for people who want to work on small parts of bigger features or for niche traits that we don't have test cases for in our default mods.

I believe that we can improve this situation, without hurting the stability or maintainability of our default mods, by allowing trait fields or entire traits to be marked as unstable using `[Desc("foo", unstable=true)]`.

These would be marked in the trait docs as unstable, indicating that modders should use these properties at their own risk.  We can then relax our review standards on these features, e.g. not requiring upgrade rules for incompatible changes, or allowing them to be merged with missing features or bugs if the benefits of the feature still outweigh the issues.

The main technical benefit comes from adding a `--disallow-unstable` flag to the `--check-yaml` utility command.  This would let us actively prevent unstable features from being accidentally or intentionally included in our shipping mods via the `make test` rule.

data.title: TD tiberium silo, refinery explosion mechanic.
data.body:
This is part of the major balance needed for TD on the economy side. Upon destroying the silo and refinery it causes an explosion to happen. Refinery can be moderate to damage harvesters near by it and silos can be major. Enough to blow up power planets at least. This would cause extra protection and caution upon clustering up refineries and silos.

The balance of silos will be implemented if this can be featured in.

This is apart of the balance ideas such as #11415 
and #11409

data.title: Overhaul the HackyAI logic

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
This PR overhauls the HackyAI logic in some Cases:
-  Replace `EnoughWaterToBuildNaval()` and `CloseEnoughToWater()` with `ProviderHasEnoughCells<T>()`
- Add `Radar` and `TechCenter` to `BuildingCommonNames`
- Replace `FindEnemyConstructionYards()` with `FindEnemyBuildings()`
- Replace `FindAndDeployBackupMcv()` with `FindAndDeployMcv()` and allow random locations on the map for the deployment when the AI has already a Construction Yard.

![deploymcv](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2057932/19203796/9b7303ae-8cd9-11e6-825c-8d1d13ef4fd5.png)

![ai_search_a_location](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2057932/19203842/d0a8507e-8cd9-11e6-8a4c-6d76759c11dd.png)

![test_normal_mcv](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2057932/19222806/f3c7f496-8e60-11e6-80c8-58881146acc2.png)

data.title: The spy's tooltip doesn't match the spy's abilities.
data.body:
The spy's tooltip says:
"Can detect cloaked units and **spies**."

According to [#8616](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8616) the "IgnoresDisguise:" trait was added to make spies detect other spies.  However they're missing the AutoTarget trait so they're unable to function correctly.

I'd suggest adding:
SPY:

> AutoTarget:
> 
> > InitialStance: HoldFire
> > ScanRadius: 5 (So they'll be able to move towards an enemy spy instead of just standing still.)

data.title: Hijacked units carry on with computers orders RA missions
data.body: Much like captured war factories and barracks in C&C, hijacked tanks etc. carry on with their old orders once taken over by the player.  This means for example in exodus, if I hijack the enemy mammoth tanks they keep driving off to where the computer last sent them.

data.title: Updated to Mono version 4.6.1
data.body: This appears to be a hotfix release http://www.mono-project.com/docs/about-mono/releases/4.6.1/ although I don't understand the urgency of the problem nor if we are effected by it. I guess not yet.

data.title: Revert "Update Mono to version 4.6.0"
data.body:
The mono 4.6 compiler breaks compatibility with mono < 4.4 runtimes, and the upstream [bug report](https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=36942) has been closed as "RESOLVED ANSWERED" so this appears to be a WONTFIX.

Reverting back to mono 4.4 restores compatibility with older runtimes until we decide to increase our minimum requirements to mono 4.4 / .NET 4.6.

Fixes #12166.

data.title: Multiplayer scorescreen ought not to cancel chat or chat message
data.body: It's a slight annoyance but often at the end of games people like to spend time typing in the chat. The scorescreen takes you out of the chat and furthermore cancels text written beforehand.

data.title: Log an error when no cells are available to spawn starting units
data.body:
Instead of crashing the game, we now just omit actors we can't spawn.

Easily testable with http://resource.openra.net/maps/16553/.

data.title: harvester.cs: Refactor ClosestProc logic
data.body: Allow only 2 Harvesters at a refinery But now All other Harvesters will wait on the Tiberium field. maybe we should give them a Order to move to the nearest free proc and wait there... In TS harvesters was waiting behind the refinery

data.title: Oil well "+100" visibility bug
data.body: Oil well "flying +100" text visible at the start. After that, if you scroll over black unexplored areas you occasionally see "flying +100" during the scrolling.

Enemy has Production Buildings but no Construction Yard(s). We will now
ensure that a Target is given :)

data.body: Fixes #7995. Mines now won't show up under fog when planted, and also removed their cloak delay so freshly planted mines under visible minelayers don't appear.
